title: Narrative Learning Design for Science Storytelling

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Learners access mobile platforms via smartphones to analyze everyday science problems through narrative frameworks

learning_goals: Learners can explain scientific concepts aligned with a narrative structure (introduction-development-crisis-resolution)

Learners select one local community issue (e.g., waste sorting, energy conservation), apply relevant scientific principles (decomposition, thermodynamics, etc.), create a storytelling-based project plan (within 3 pages), and complete final presentation materials incorporating peer evaluation and expert feedback (achieving at least 3 points on a 5-point scale).
Learners can validate the effectiveness of narrative educational content through peer evaluation

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
